results.title: Such is life = C'est la vie
results.creator_credit: Diane Kurys, Alexandre Arcady and Samuel Goldwyn Productions
results.brief_description: From the acclaimed director of ‘Entre Nous’, ‘C’est la vie’ is a touching story of a young teenager who witnesses the disintegration of her parents’ marriage over the summer vacation. Julie Bataille plays Frederique, who must deal with her own emerging sexuality as well as witnessing her mother’s sexual antics with her lover, an artist called Jean-Claude. The film is rich in detail and ambience and captures the bittter-sweet poignancy of growing up.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Diane Kurys, Alexandre Arcady and Samuel Goldwyn Productions
results.description: From the acclaimed director of ‘Entre Nous’, ‘C’est la vie’ is a touching story of a young teenager who witnesses the disintegration of her parents’ marriage over the summer vacation. results.title: Such a stupid way to die
results.creator_credit: Philip McDonald, David H. Fowler and New Zealand National Film Unit
results.brief_description: The biggest single killer in the mountains is accidental hypothermia - exposure to cold. This dramatised case study of five people going for a weekend tramp details why it is such a stupid way to die when one of the party suffers severe exposure. This program provides the reasons why he died and what could have prevented his unnecessary death.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Philip McDonald, David H. Fowler and New Zealand National Film Unit

results.title: Succession on lava
results.creator_credit: Bert Van Bork and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Biology program; unit 1. Ecology”
Illustrates the destruction caused by a volcanic eruption in Hawaii, and examines the difficulties encountered by the first forms of life that re-appear. Traces the stages of ecological succession, from the blue-green algae to the re-establishment of a mature biotic community.

results.title: Succession from sand dune to forest
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Biology program; unit 1. Ecology”.
Explains that succession is the process by which a given area changes slowly and continuously until it finally becomes a stable community. Shows one of the earliest and most thoroughly studied examples of this process on the shore of Lake Michigan

results.title: Successful study skills
results.brief_description: Produced specially for Australian students undergoing senior years of schooling. Topics covered include: the need to establish a good study environment, good planning and time management principles, whole year planning, weekly timetable, the use of a student diary, the value of library research, stress and how to cope, relaxation techniques. Study guide included.

Study guide included.

results.title: Successful staff selection: the employment interview
results.brief_description: An illustration of how the manager prepares for, and handles, an interview to assess a candidate for a particular job. Job specifications, unobtrusive control of the form of the interview, handling stress on the candidate, etc. are related to a full length simulated interview for a job.

results.title: Successful sound for video
results.creator_credit: Chris Wonsky, Mik Parsons and ViT
results.brief_description: To create a successful video story it is essential that the correct type of sound is used for each shot. This video describes the situations in which both sync sound and non-sync sound should be used. It also discusses the issues surrounding different types of microphones (handheld, gun, personal), Mono and stereo soundtracks, recording non-sync sound (tape recorders, video camera recorder, commercial sound effects recordings), sound levels and distortion (under- and over-modulation) and mixing sounds using equalisers to control relative volumes, tone and the positioning of sound.

results.title: Successful scholarship
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Psychology for Living”
Assists students in developing sound study methods by depicting techniques worked out by a student of nursing who has adapted hospital routines to the forming of study habits based on three concepts: systematic planning, a suitable place for study and concentration, a definite method for assimilating the content of each assignment.

results.title: Successful lighting for video
results.creator_credit: Chris Wonsky, Mik Parsons and ViT
results.brief_description: This video emphasises the importance of lighting in successfully portraying the subject of a shot in a video. The areas covered include: contrast; quality; intensity; direction and colour.

results.title: Successful instruction - an illustrated lecture
results.creator_credit: T.L. Rich, Ronald H. Riley and R.H.R. Productions
results.brief_description: A dramatised lecture on instruction intended for those learning to teach. A young officer gives a detailed explanation of the three principles of good instruction - prepare and plan; promote and maintain the desire to learn; and confirm that instruction has been assimilated.
